results.title: Square pegs
results.creator_credit: John Mansfield and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Today, applying for a job often means submitting to innumerable tests, not only of ability and intelligence, but also of personality. But just how valid are these tests? This program examines some of the techniques used by the boom industry of Management Selection and follows two candidates through their ordeal.

results.title: Traditions
results.creator_credit: Con Bell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Conscription brought Con Bell into World War II. Regardless of how he entered the war, Con is proud of the part he played in the development of a new army tradition. A member of the first permanent commando squadrons, he reflects on how this experience has shaped the man he is today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Con Bell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Spike
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Documentary which explains the disease of epilepsy and looks at research which is being done into its causes and how to treat it. Includes extensive interviews with epilepsy sufferers who describe their symptoms and their feelings about the disease and the social stigma attached to it. Presented and narrated by Dr Peter Fenwick.

results.title: Spend and prosper: a portrait of John Maynard Keynes
results.creator_credit: Christopher La Fontaine and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Traces the life of John Maynard Keynes through the eyes of some of the people who knew and worked with him. They include Quentin Bell, J.K. Galbraith and Ninette de Valois. Also spells out some of his economic theories which are in direct opposition to the monetarist policies followed by today’s (1980’s) governments. Narrated by Paul Vaughan.
results.title_for_label: Spend and prosper: a portrait of John Maynard Keynes
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher La Fontaine and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Traces the life of John Maynard Keynes through the eyes of some of the people who knew and worked with him. They include Quentin Bell, J.K. Galbraith and Ninette de Valois. Also spells out some of his economic theories which are in direct opposition to the monetarist policies followed by today’s (1980’s) governments. Narrated by Paul Vaughan.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Traces the life of John Maynard Keynes through the eyes of some of the people who knew and worked with him. They include Quentin Bell, J.K. Galbraith and Ninette de Valois. Also spells out some of his economic theories which are in direct opposition to the monetarist policies followed by today’s (1980’s) governments. Narrated by Paul Vaughan.

results.title: Homecoming
results.creator_credit: Grant Coultman-Smith, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Despite the horrors of fighting in the Vietnam War, Grant Coultman-Smith and his fellow soldiers were unprepared for the reception when they returned to Australia. Rejected by the people, the Returned Services League and even the Government, Grant and his colleagues found comfort and support in each other as they fought the psychological effects of war and achieving greater recognition for their service in the community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Grant Coultman-Smith, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Despite the horrors of fighting in the Vietnam War, Grant Coultman-Smith and his fellow soldiers were unprepared for the reception when they returned to Australia. results.title: Silent speech (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
A study of non-verbal communication in young children featuring the work of biologist Prof. Hubert Montagner who has discovered a correlation between the behavior of children and the attitudes of the mother toward the child. He also suggests that physiological changes in the mother - specifically the level of various hormones - are mirrored in the child. Made by British Boradcasting Corporation.

results.title: Persevere
results.creator_credit: John Vincent, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Soon after landing in South Vietnam, John Vincent was sent to Pleiku to serve as a Platoon Commander. In telling of his time in Pleiku, John considers the cultural assumptions he made and the importance of his training in military action.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Vincent, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Correspondence
results.creator_credit: Gordon White, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Despite being born on Friday the 13th, Gordon White was always considered to be lucky. With luck on his side, he joined the Australian Navy and spent most of his time on the HMAS Sydney, a battleship that had survived 80-90 bombing raids with no loss of life. When he was posted on another ship, Gordon soon realised that downside to being lucky - witnessing the suffering of others.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gordon White, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Despite being born on Friday the 13th, Gordon White was always considered to be lucky. With luck on his side, he joined the Australian Navy and spent most of his time on the HMAS Sydney, a battleship that had survived 80-90 bombing raids with no loss of life. When he was posted on another ship, Gordon soon realised that downside to being lucky - witnessing the suffering of others.
description_for_label: Despite being born on Friday the 13th, Gordon White was always considered to be lucky. With luck on his side, he joined the Australian Navy and spent most of his time on the HMAS Sydney, a battleship that had survived 80-90 bombing raids with no loss of life. When he was posted on another ship, Gordon soon realised that downside to being lucky - witnessing the suffering of others.

results.title: One of thousands
results.creator_credit: Ralph Basson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As a veteran who served in Normandy during World War II, Ralph Basson takes us on a sensory tour of war. In this, Ralph highlights the things you cling to in order to survive. ‘With all the chaos going on around you, you have to remember your training and just put one foot in front of the other’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ralph Basson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: As a veteran who served in Normandy during World War II, Ralph Basson takes us on a sensory tour of war. In this, Ralph highlights the things you cling to in order to survive. ‘With all the chaos going on around you, you have to remember your training and just put one foot in front of the other’.
description_for_label: As a veteran who served in Normandy during World War II, Ralph Basson takes us on a sensory tour of war. In this, Ralph highlights the things you cling to in order to survive. ‘With all the chaos going on around you, you have to remember your training and just put one foot in front of the other’.
